title: Off-heap memory leak using snapshots

### Description
When using snapshots it has been observed that off-heap memory leaks.  RocksDB logs also indicate that snapshots are not getting released.  Once a snapshot is leaked, the `oldest_snapshot_seqno` remains constant throughout the life of a besu process :
```
2022/11/08-01:28:39.946559 139974914029312 EVENT_LOG_v1 {"time_micros": 1667870919946550, "job": 50, "event": "compaction_started", "compaction_reason": "LevelL0FilesNum", "files_L0": [621, 617, 615, 613], "files_L1": [608, 609, 610, 611], "score": 1, "input_data_size": 260512738, "oldest_snapshot_seqno": 33590718}
2022/11/08-01:30:48.183919 139974922422016 EVENT_LOG_v1 {"time_micros": 1667871048183898, "job": 57, "event": "compaction_started", "compaction_reason": "LevelL0FilesNum", "files_L0": [637, 631, 629, 627], "files_L1": [622, 623, 624, 625], "score": 1, "input_data_size": 297480461, "oldest_snapshot_seqno": 33590718}
2022/11/08-01:30:54.165198 139974922422016 EVENT_LOG_v1 {"time_micros": 1667871054165190, "job": 58, "event": "compaction_started", "compaction_reason": "LevelMaxLevelSize", "files_L1": [638, 639, 640, 641, 642], "files_L2": [501], "score": 1.073, "input_data_size": 320400391, "oldest_snapshot_seqno": 33590718}
2022/11/08-01:32:40.786066 139974939207424 EVENT_LOG_v1 {"time_micros": 1667871160786056, "job": 63, "event": "compaction_started", "compaction_reason": "LevelL0FilesNum", "files_L0": [655, 653, 651, 649], "score": 1, "input_data_size": 42147890, "oldest_snapshot_seqno": 33590718}
2022/11/08-01:32:56.672884 139974914029312 EVENT_LOG_v1 {"time_micros": 1667871176672876, "job": 65, "event": "compaction_started", "compaction_reason": "LevelL0FilesNum", "files_L0": [658, 635, 619, 605], "files_L1": [576, 577, 578, 580], "score": 1, "input_data_size": 356540734, "oldest_snapshot_seqno": 33590718}
```

This clearly indicates that besu is not correctly releasing snapshots for some usages of mutable worldstate.

### Acceptance Criteria
* off-heap memory should not leak when snapshots are enabled
* rocksdb compaction should not be impacted by stale snapshots

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. enable snapshots `--Xbonsai-use-snapshots=true`
2. full-sync any blockchain
3. observe the off-heap memory increase proportional to the number of blocks processed

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
stable memory usage

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
progressive memory leak

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
100% of the time, but it is most noticeable over many block executions, such as during a full sync

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 22.10.0+
